Posts.EditableText: Is there a way to save your progress in editing so you don't have to work to get up to the same spot to see if your edit worked? If that makes sense.
Posts.HTML: Is there a way to save your progress in editing so you don't have to work to get up to the same spot to see if your edit worked? If that makes sense.

Posts.EditableText:
If using the offline version, you can create a walk-through, which is a list of in-game commands. You can play the walk through to get to the same place each time. Easiest way to create a walk-through is to use the record facility.

Otherwise, create a special command, that jumps the player to a certain place (and sets any attributes). Remember to delete it before release!
Posts.HTML:
If using the offline version, you can create a walk-through, which is a list of in-game commands. You can play the walk through to get to the same place each time. Easiest way to create a walk-through is to use the record facility.

Otherwise, create a special command, that jumps the player to a certain place (and sets any attributes). Remember to delete it before release!

Posts.EditableText: Oh man. You're amazing. That's exactly what I wanted. Now I don't have to play the game every 20 seconds just to check for adjustments. You have no idea how irritating that as getting.
